synopsis: Vote to pass a bill that authorizes local governments and school districts to prohibit guns on capital and state property.
name: SB 554 - Authorizes Local Governments and School Districts to Prohibit Guns on Capital and State Property - Oregon Key Vote
pg: Highlights: Authorizes any entity that owns, occupies, or controls a public building to adopt any ordinance, rule, or policy limiting or precluding the possession of a firearm by individuals licensed to own firearms in those public buildings owned, occupied, or controlled by the entity (Sec. 1). Specifies that the aforementioned ordinance may not limit or preclude the possession of a firearm in any area that serves as a parking area or parking garage (Sec. 1). Requires that any entity that adopts an ordinance, rule, or policy under this act to post a sign, with a universally understandable symbol, visible to the public, identifying all locations where the aforementioned ordinance is in effect and firearms are prohibited (Sec. 1). Classifies a “public building” as (Sec. 2-9): A hospital; A capitol building; A public or private school; A college or university; A city hall; The residence of any state official elected by the state at large[, and the grounds adjacent to each such building; A building owned by the state or by a city, a county, a district or any other entity that falls within the definition of “municipal corporation”; or The portion of any other building occupied or controlled by an agency of the state or by a city, a county, a district, or any other entity that falls within the definition of “municipal corporation”, other than a court facility.
